attributes.action: Improve provisions for self-employed people affected by Covid19
attributes.additional_details:
Covid19 means many self-employed can't work.
Infection control measures mean client cancellations & work locations forced shut.
The SE contribute millions in tax/NI & are a vital part of tradecraft, leisure & personal services but are the only group of workers ignored by Govt emergency provisions.
Universal Credit is too complex & unsuitable - eg it requires assessment, a delay, it's means tested so penalises SE who saved for their tax bill, it includes partner income, etc. - we need more help!
attributes.background: Govt should at minimum offer a Universal Basic Uncome for those Self Employed (SE) who have lost over a certain % of monthly income due to Covid19, & should consider extending the provisions announced for other workers to the SE during the Covid19 restriction period. Universal Credit is unsuitable.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
